name: Fast & Slow Pointer
description: Move two pointers at different speeds to detect cycles or middle elements.

overview.what: Use a fast pointer (2x) and a slow pointer (1x) to spot cycles or locate midpoints.
overview.when: Use on linked lists or sequences where detecting cycles or midpoints matters.

steps.reason: Start both slow and fast at the head node.
Move slow one step each iteration.
Move fast two steps; it will catch slow if a cycle exists.
If fast and slow meet, a cycle is present.
If fast hits null, there is no cycle.
